page.title: 01A VIEW OF BUCKLAND BREWER
page.content: THE{FIELDS}AROUND THE AREA ARE RARELY LARGER THAN TWENTY ACRES.THEY ARE MOSTLY COVERED BY GRASS AND ARE SHAPED MAINLY IN IRREGULAR OBLONGS.BUCKLAND BREWER IS MAINLY COVERED BY FIELDS BUT HAS A FEW SMALL WOODS AROUND.THE FIELDS ARE SEPARATED BY{HEDGES.}HEDGES ARE BUSHES AND SMALL TREES CLUMPED TOGETHER TO ACT AS BOUNDARIES BETWEEN FIELDS. THE{HIGHEST POINT}IN BUCKLAND BREWER IS JENNYS HOUSE WHERE IT IS ABOUT FIVE HUNDRED FEET ABOVE SEA LEVEL.YOU CAN SEE FOR MILES AROUND FROM JENNYS HOUSE.JENNYS HOUSE IS CALLED LONG VIEW BECAUSE YOU CAN SEE FOR A LONG WAY. THE{ROADS}IN OUR AREA ARE NARROW AND TWISTY .THEY ARE QUITE ROUGH AND HAVE LOTS OF GATEWAYS ALONG THEM.
